data.title: Facebook is 'addictive, bad for us,' says Salesforce CEO
data.text: Marc Benioff says the social media platform needs to be "held accountable for propaganda."

data.title: Zuckerberg meets with lawmakers ahead of next week's testimony
data.text: CNBC's Ylan Mui reports that Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg was at the Capitol today.

data.title: Facebook's Libra Co-Founder still hoping for 2020 launch despite regulatory challenges
data.text: The Facebook-led Libra Association lost numerous investors last week including Visa and MasterCard. However, this week it locked in 21 founding members at a meeting in Geneva. Yahoo Finance’s Brian Cheung sat down with Facebook’s Calibra Head David Marcus to discuss about Libra's trials and tribulations.

data.title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff says Facebook is a corrosive influence and should be broken up
data.text: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff hasn't been sparing with his criticism of Facebook. But in an interview with CNN's Poppy Harlow Wednesday he went one significant step further and added his name to the list of those who support breaking up the social media giant.

data.title: Tech companies under fire for security liabilities
data.text: Nancy Scola, senior technology reporter at Politico, and CNBC's Ylan Mui join "The Exchange" to talk about tech companies taking on liability issues.

data.title: Uptake of libra currency could increase exchange rate risk: Obama adviser | IMF Annual Meetings 2019
data.text: Jason Furman, professor of the practice of economic policy at Harvard Kennedy School, discusses digital currencies.

data.title: Facebook executive confident Libra will win enough financial backers
data.text: Facebook Inc , whose digital currency project Libra has been abandoned by several high-profile partners including PayPal, Visa and Mastercard, still expects to get 100 banks and financial firms on board once it addresses regulatory concerns, the head of the project said on Wednesday.

data.title: Facebook won't have access to libra data, head of Calibra says
data.text: Calibra chief David Marcus discusses privacy concerns around Facebook's digital currency project.

data.title: No shortage of global desire to help launch libra currency: Calibra chief
data.text: David Marcus, head of Calibra, the digital wallet for Facebook's proposed cryptocurrency libra, discusses the future of payments.

data.title: Libra would have a 'very wide range of issues' to resolve: Carney
data.text: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney discusses big tech's presence in the financial services market and the future of payments.

data.title: Better Tech Stock Buy: Facebook vs. Google Parent Alphabet
data.text: Which of these big tech stocks is the better investment for the long term?

data.title: Libra co-creator Marcus: 'There is no shortage of desire and shared mission to join this effort'
data.text: The co-creator of Facebook-backed cryptocurrency libra said there is still strong demand from organizations to join the project.

data.title: Can Facebook's Libra be a Winner in Emerging Markets?
data.text: Libra could be the ideal digital currency to benefit emerging markets owing to its technical expertise and secure blockchain technology.

data.title: Libra's co-creator at Facebook touts progress after an exodus of key backers of the crypto coin
data.text: David Marcus, head of Facbook's Calibra digital wallet, says, "It wasn't a tough week," despite the news of Libra backers recently abandoning the project.

data.title: 3 Big Stock Charts for Wednesday: Facebook, Charles Schwab, and JPMorgan Chase
data.text:
Three big stock charts for Wednesday include two post-earnings movers - and FB stock, who could show the way for large-cap tech.

data.title: Jefferies Very Positive on 4 Top Internet Stocks in Front of Q3 Results
data.text: If any technological advancement has become 100% ubiquitous for most Americans it is the internet.
